text:
Steelworker Explains Why He Switched Sides to Vote for Trump 
Joe Tanner, who was chairman of Georgia’s Commission on Privatization of State Services during Miller’s time as governor, thinks that Trump’s presidency is a fantastic chance to do the same to the federal government quagmire. 
“This is a tremendous opportunity for the federal government, and Georgia can be a model,” Tanner told The Daily Signal. 
“That doesn’t necessarily mean they need to do it how we did it, but we could be a model.”   
Basically, it would force government employees to work under the same conditions employees in the private sector do — without civil service protections for incompetence or a poor work ethic, and putting a maximum stress on efficiency. (That would be a new thing for government workers all by itself.) 
“It worked beautifully to transform state government because people knew they had to get to work, even if they had a little sniffle,” Tanner added. 
“A lot of people will say, ‘You have to protect the civil servants,’” he said. “Who gets cut out of the picture when you protect the civil servant? The average citizen dealing with a bunch of bureaucrats.” 
He couldn’t be more right about that.
